name: BD+49 828
scenarioDescription:
The BD+49 828 Exoplanetary System


Overview

BD+49 828 is a star with 1.52 times the mass of the Sun, and 7.6 times its radius. It is located 1459.84 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.34 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

BD+49 828 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the BD+49 828 system


BD+49 828 b

BD+49 828 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 4.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD+49 828 b is 508.8 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD+49 828 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system BD+49 828, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by McDonald Observatory.
